statement:
If $\gcd(a,\,c) = 1$ and $c|ab$, then $c|b$.

[*Proof.*]{} gives the integers $x$ and $y$ such that $xa+yc = 1$. This
implies that $xab+ybc = b$, and because here the both summands are
divisible by $c$, so also the sum, i.e. $b$, is divisible by $c$ .

**Note.** A similar theorem holds in all , also in [*Bézout rings*]{}.
